text: Hi <@UECFPB6G1> its not showing in page source. When I add the markup in settings > pages > template > site header HTML it renders like theres an issue. The text is white.
I’ve checked the mark up here - <https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool>
It comes back with no errors and no warnings
I figured it out. You can’t use the All domain option in settings you have to select a domain from the dropdown.
Ah, yep, that'll do it– subdomain-specific settings will always override whatever is specified in "All Domains".

Hello everyone
happy to be part of the community of the HubSpot developpers, I am Frederic from markentive, a french agency
Is there a custom object in HubSpot? I want to create a custom object and insert it with the CRM extension API
thanks a lot

question about redirects: Is it possible to setup redirects for a sub-domain that is not connected, we have a cut-over that is pretty timely, and wondering if we can setup redirects before the sub-domain is connected?
Sorry <@U22PKFRU5> only just seen this. Leveraging Browser Caching. If HubSpot handles this then great.
Cheers <@U22PKFRU5> I was having issues adding schema mark up to the head. Turns out you have to select a sub domain when adding.
<@UGMGP7A72> HubSpot caches content at our CDN edge now for most things content related (images, pages, files, etc).  Is there something beyond that you'd want cached?

*Hoping our :sprocket: developer community can help* :pray: We're working on our CMS talk for Partner Day @ INBOUND ...

Two questions, please reply in the thread for each question...
> - 1) What are the most common :sprocket: HubSpot CMS objections / anxieties / limitations your team hears in the sales process or from leadership?
> - 2) What  are the most common objections / anxieties / limitations your *internal* team (sales, strategists, developers, designers, etc) bring up when thinking about :sprocket: HubSpot CMS?
I'll kick us off...

I'll kick this one off...

Anxiety: "I'll need to learn a whole new system and all of its quirks."
Anxiety: "Will HubSpot CMS properly integrate  into our existing (CRM/ERP/Automation) systems?"

designers and content creaters
>Why can’t I edit a global module? I don’t want to go the design manager. It needs to be like Shopify’s Theme editor (the global module part)

>it’s expensive.
>also, what happens if they don’t want to use HubSpot anymore?

another limitation that comes up:
> it needs _advanced_ membership-type functionality

Anyone have experience integrating a Square Payment Form into a HubSpot landing page? Wondering if there's a simple solution (HubSpot x Square plugin perhaps?) or if I'll have to build out the functionality from scratch.

:eyes: the jinja docs mention a lipsum function. Gonna try that and see if it works
range(1...3)
lipsum function does not appear to be a thing.

good use: `range(10 - users|count)`
